text.__SUMMARY__:
Fritillaria crassicaulis is an Asian species of herbaceous plant in the lily family, native to Sichuan and Yunnan Provinces in China.Fritillaria crassicaulis is a bulb-forming perennial up to 80 cm tall. Flowers are nodding (hanging downward), yellow or greenish yellow, often with brown or purple spots.Flora of China lists Fritillaria wabuensis as an additional synonym of F. crassicaulis, but World Checklist considers F. wabuensis a synonym for the accepted F. unibracteata var. wabuensis.
